<div><a href="http://underthebutton.com/2011/12/penn-med-students-provide-health-screenings-at-barbershops/screen-shot-2011-12-30-at-3-59-41-pm/" rel="attachment wp-att-38023"><img class="alignright size-medium wp-image-38023" title="Screen shot 2011-12-30 at 3.59.41 PM" src="http://underthebutton.com/blog/wp-content/imagescaler/c347ff7bfe04a355aebcf670a948ec7b.png" alt="" width="300" height="197" /></a>In barbershops that act as community hubs, Penn Med students <a href="http://www.philly.com/philly/health/Testing_for_hypertension_at_the_barbershop.html" target="_blank">saw an opportunity for public health education</a>. Toting blood pressure cuffs and literature about healthy lifestyle choices, Penn students visit barbershops across Philly to administer tests for hypertension. Check out the pic courtesy of <a href="http://www.philly.com/" target="_blank">Philly.com</a>&#8216;s Ashlee Espinal.</p>
<div>The initiative was founded by third year Penn Med student Sheriff Akinleye, a member of the Penn Med chapter of the Student National Medical Association. Haircuts and free health screenings and courtesy of Penn Med students– doesn&#8217;t that make you feel all warm and fuzzy inside?</div>
